title: US To Withdraw Some 1,000 Troops From Syria
description: The United States will roughly halve the number of troops it has deployed in Syria to less than 1,000 in the coming months, the Pentagon said Friday.

title: Canada Election 2025: 5 Unusual Facts About The Canadian Parliamentary Polls
description: As Canada preps to elect a new government on April 28, the two parties that are leading the race - the Conservative Party and the Liberal Party - are in close contest. This is a parliamentary election, but the Canadian polls have some unique facts.

description: China is the biggest foreign patron of Cambodia, where Mr. Xi concluded a tour of Southeast Asia. But the region also needs to curry favor with President Trump.

title: Ukraine says it has signed the outline of a minerals deal with the U.S.
description: Ukraine said Thursday that it had signed the basis of a minerals deal with the U.S., although the details of the agreement are yet to be announced.

title: Congo boat disaster death toll rises to 148, with more than 100 still missing
description: Fire broke out during onboard cooking before wooden vessel capsized with 500 passengers aboardThe death toll from a boat fire and capsizing in the Democratic Republic of Congo earlier this week has risen to 148 with more than 100 people still missing, officials said on Friday.About 500 passengers were on board the wooden boat when it capsized on Tuesday after catching fire on the Congo River in the country’s north-west. Continue reading...
author: Associated Press in Kinshasa

title: ICJ hears Sudan case accusing UAE of ‘complicity in genocide’
description: United Arab Emirates says Sudan ‘misusing’ world court in proceedings relating to African nation’s civil warThe international court of justice will rule in the next few weeks on whether the United Arab Emirates can be plausibly found “complicit in the commission of genocide” by arming the Rapid Support Forces militia in Sudan’s civil war.The case was brought by Sudan, whose acting justice minister, Muawia Osman, told the world court in The Hague last week that the country’s “ongoing genocide would not be possible without the complicity of the UAE, including the shipment of arms to the RSF”. Sudan wants ICJ judges to force the UAE to stop its alleged support for the RSF and make “full reparations”, including compensation to victims of the war. Continue reading...
author: Patrick Wintour Diplomatic editor

title: What Trump said in first reaction on deported Maryland man Kilmar linked to MS-13
description: Donald Trump defended the deportation of Kilmar Abrego Garcia, linking him to MS-13 with a photo of a tattooed hand. This sparked controversy after images surfaced of Abrego Garcia with Senator Chris Van Hollen in El Salvador. Despite a court order blocking his removal, Abrego Garcia was deported, leading to accusations of due process violations.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Texas stabbing tragedy: Murdered teen's house swatted with fake shooting report
author: TOI World Desk

title: Sen. Van Hollen discusses El Salvador visit with wrongly deported man
description: Sen. Chris Van Hollen said Kilmar Abrego García, the Maryland man wrongly deported to El Salvador, has “experienced trauma, he said he’s sad every day.”
author: Silvia Foster-Frau, Theodoric Meyer, Maegan Vazquez

title: Trump ready to ‘move on’ from Ukraine peace talks if no progress, Rubio says
description: Rubio’s remarks appear to reflect the president’s frustration with the difficulty of achieving peace in Ukraine after Russia’s 2022 full-scale invasion.
author: Adam Taylor, Robyn Dixon, Ellen Francis
